Detailed Description

Matchers that decorate other matchers for better expression.

Define Documentation

#define describedAs (   description,
  matcher,
  ... 
)    HC_describedAs(description, matcher, ##__VA_ARGS__)

Wraps an existing matcher and overrides the description when it fails.

Optional values following the matcher are substituted for %0, %1, etc., in the description. The last argument must be nil.

Synonym for HC_describedAs, available if HC_SHORTHAND is defined.

See also:
HCDescribedAs
#define is   HC_is

is(match) - Decorates another matcher, or provides a shortcut to the frequently used is(equalTo(x)).

If match is a matcher, its behavior is retained, but the test may be more expressive.

If match is not a matcher, it is wrapped in an equalTo matcher. This makes the following three statements the same: 

assertThat(cheese, equalTo(smelly))
assertThat(cheese, is(equalTo(smelly)))
assertThat(cheese, is(smelly))

Choose the style that makes your expression most readable. This will vary depending on context.

Synonym for HC_is, available if HC_SHORTHAND is defined.

See also:
HCIs

Wraps an existing matcher and overrides the description when it fails.

Optional values following the matcher are substituted for %0, %1, etc., in the description. The last argument must be nil.

Synonym: describedAs

id<HCMatcher> HC_is ( id  match  ) 

Decorates another matcher, or provides a shortcut to the frequently used is(equalTo(x)).

If match is a matcher, its behavior is retained, but the test may be more expressive.

If match is not a matcher, it is wrapped in an equalTo matcher. This makes the following three statements the same: 

assertThat(cheese, equalTo(smelly))
assertThat(cheese, is(equalTo(smelly)))
assertThat(cheese, is(smelly))

Choose the style that makes your expression most readable. This will vary depending on context.

Synonym: is
